questions.question: Which of the following prompted the call for a convention to fix the Articles in 1787?

choices.answer: disagreement between Upcountry and Lowcountry people in SC
the refusal of the British to open their trade to Americans
a rebellion of  backcountry farmers in Massachusetts
an attack by Native Americans on upstate New York

questions.question: What did the delegates to the Philadelphia Convention decide to do after they got there?

choices.answer: elect a President
establish a court system
write a new constitution
revise the Articles of Confederation

questions.question: Why did states with smaller populations object to the Virginia Plan?

choices.answer: Were concerned that the debate would destroy the convention
Objected to counting slaves in the South
Believed that each state should have more than one vote
Feared that the large states would out vote them

questions.question: Which of the states would be most likely to oppose the Virginia Plan for rep. based on pop.?

choices.answer: Pennsylvania
New Jersey
Massachusetts
New York

questions.question: How did the Great Compromise solve the problem of rep. during the Constitutional Convention?

choices.answer: Rep would be based on population in both houses of Congress.
Each state would have an equal number of representatives
Slaves would count as3/5 of a person & slave trade would end
Rep would be = in the Senate & proportional in the House

questions.question: How did the 3/5 Compromise resolve the debate of how population was to be counted?

choices.answer: allowed 3/5 of reps to Congress to be chosen by the states
counted 3/5 of all white men in any state as part of its pop
allowed 3/5 of the slaves in each state to vote
counted 3/5 of slaves as part of state pop. for rep. & taxes

questions.question: Which of the following provisions did the South Carolina delegates support?

choices.answer: only property owners should be able to hold political office
all people born in the country should have the right to vote
exports and important should be taxed
representation should be equal

questions.question: How did Charles Pinckney influence SC’s ratification of the US Constitution?

choices.answer: He was an Anti-Federalist and opposed to the new Const.
He was a Federalist who persuaded ppl to vote for new Const.
He opposed the 3/5 Comp. & refused to support ratification
Agreed to vote for the Const. if a bill of rights was added

questions.question: Why did many in the Upcountry oppose ratification of the Constitution w/o a Bill of Rights?

choices.answer: afraid the states would be too powerful
thought that a BoR would strengthen the President's power
did not want the national government to have an army
feared that the new national govt would be too powerful

questions.question: What reason was given by the Anti-Federalists to oppose the United States Constitution?

choices.answer: gave too little power to Congress
did not provide for a president or a supreme court
gave the north more power than the south
did not protect the individual rights of American citizens

questions.question: Why did SCs delegates vote to ratify the Const even though most Upcountry farmers opposed?

choices.answer: Upcountry delegates agreed to ratify if capital was moved
Upcountry delegates did not represent their citizens fairly.
Lowcountry delegates bribed Upcountry delegates for rat.
Lowcountry delegates made up the majority of the convention.

questions.question: John is an elite planter, wants a strong central govt, & opposes a bill of rights. John is a...

choices.answer: Anti-Federalists
Federalists
New Jersey Plan
Virginia Plan

questions.question: Although Jefferson supported the Const., why was he concerned about the new govt?

choices.answer: no provision to protect the rights of the people
too much power given to the state governments
lack of a ‘separation of powers’
similar to the tyranny of the British government
